Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: INT. PRESS BRIEFING ROOM - DAY
Scenes.Description: C.J. is informally talking to the members of the press as she's looking over a slide sheet.

Dialogues.Line: The first lady will be wearing a Badgely Mischka silk Shantung gown with a beaded bodice.
Shoes?
I believe she will be wearing shoes, yes.
Black suede and velvet with a Manolo Blahnik slides with a rhinestone and mother of pearl toe buckle.
Accessories?
Gabriel Sanchez freshwater pearl necklace with tourmaline beads. I'm also told to inform you she will be carrying a Christina Bomba silk pleated organdy drawstring evening bag.
And Mrs. Siguto?
Mrs. Siguto will be wearing a traditional silk kegaya in dark purple with an overlay of black silk lace.
C.J.?
Matching open-toe evening slippers. Her jewelry is by an artist from her birthplace, which is Jakarta. Josh appears and waits for C.J. to finish.

It is fashioned with rubies and gold. Anything else? [No response.] Nothing on the nuclear test ban treaty? [More silence.] No? Okay. Thank you. [gets up and walks to the briefing podium, Josh following]

Man alive, do I love it when In Style magazine is issued press credentials. Mirabella needed to know what kind of wine is being served with the fish course. So, it's a good thing I went to school for 22 years.
What wine are we...?
It's wine and you'll drink it.
Okay.
What do you need? C.J. and Josh walk out to the HALLWAY and continue the conversation.
Sarah is picking up speed and power and has now been classified as a class four system. You might want to talk about preparations and contingencies.
Sure. What are we talking about?
Hurricane Sarah.
Sarah's a hurricane.
Yes.
Where is it heading?
Georgia and parts of the Carolinas.
When?
It will hit landfall by tonight.
Is it serious?
Have you ever been in a hurricane?
No.
Me neither, but they look pretty serious. They go into the COMMUNICATIONS BULLPEN where they meet up with Sam.
Just so you know, they've voted to strike.
The teamsters?
Fifteen minutes ago. Leo's putting them in a room.
When?
Now.
How long is it going to last? Sam, Josh and C.J. walk out to the HALLWAY.
Till midnight. Taft-Hartley expires, that's why they're going to walk.
There's a state dinner tonight.
We'll make more food.
Josh... They reach C.J.'S OFFICE AREA where Toby is waiting.
Don't worry about it.
[to Toby] Hey, did you know about the hurricane?
Yeah.
Everybody but me? They all enter C.J.'S OFFICE. C.J. walks to her desk. The others fill the room.
Listen, I want you to start preparing for something. There's a situation in McClane.
Virginia?
Idaho.
What's in Idaho?
There's a property there that local law enforcements had surrounded for four days. A farmhouse, with anywhere from 18 to 40 Survivalists.
Are they armed?
Yeah.
Are there kids?
Yes. C.J. grimaces to Sam, who puts his head down.
The F.B.I. decided it's a hostage situation. So, we have ourselves a whole new ball game.

So, let me see if I have this. [looks at Josh] A hurricane's picked up speed and power and is heading for Georgia. [looks at Sam] Management and labor are coming here to work out a settlement to avoid a crippling strike that will begin at midnight tonight. [looks at Toby] And the government's planning a siege on 18 to 40 of its citizens, all the while we host a state dinner for the President of Indonesia. JOSH and TOBY Yeah.
You got it. Sondra walks in and tries to get C.J.'s attention.
Amazingly, you know what I'll get asked most often today?
What?
Sondra?
I'm sorry, C.J....
Black suede and velvet. Manolo Blahnik slides with a rhinestone and mother of pearl toe buckle.
[writes it down] Thanks.
No problem. Sondra leaves as C.J. looks at Josh, at Sam, and at Toby.

Scenes.Scene Heading: SMASH CUT TO: MAIN TITLES.
FADE IN: INT. JOSH'S OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Josh is on the phone. Radio is on about the storm.

Dialogues.Line: Low-pressure system. It's another low-pressure system. Okay, I'm talking to the Red Cross. I'll call you in about an hour... Yeah. Bye. He hangs up and walks out of his office to JOSH'S BULLPEN AREA.
Donnatella Moss!
Hey.

A senior Indonesian deputy is coming tonight. Toby and I want to talk to him alone for a few minutes. I need you to find out if he can speak English and if he can't, we need to get an interpreter from State.
What's his name?
Ramahedi Sumahedjo Bambang. Conversation moves to the HALLWAY.
Can you spell that?
Not correctly, no.
Josh...
Yes.
I've got to tell you something.
What?
I'm not wild about this whole Indonesian thing.
What's the problem?
I've been doing some reading on my own.
I wish you wouldn't do that.
Why?
Because you tend to call some bizarre factoid from a less than reputable source and then you blow it all out of proportion.
[peeved] I do not.
Donna... They walk to the COMMUNICATIONS BULLPEN.
I just thought you might like to know that in certain parts of Indonesia, they summarily execute people they suspect of being sorcerers.
[stops] What?
I read it.
They... summarily execute people they suspect of being sorcerers?
They behead them.
Sorcerers. Josh and Donna are just on their way through THE ROOSEVELT ROOM.
Gangs of roving people. Beheading those they suspect of being sorcerers. You know with... what's that thing that Death carries?
A scythe.
They're doing it with a scythe.
Well, thanks for the head's up.
I thought you might like to know who's coming over for dinner.
You bet. JOSH ends up in LEO'S OFFICE. Leo enters through another door. C.J., Sam, Toby and Mandy are already there while Leo leans against his desk.
I heard it got upgraded.
It's a class 4 hurricane. FEMA's down in Georgia with the Red Cross. The President should be prepared to sign some sort of federal disaster relief. What's going on with the truckers?
I'm meeting with them in the Roosevelt Room in an hour.
C.J.'s going to need to know what they're wearing.
Yeah.
What's the issue?
Two tiered hiring.

A company divides its workforce into two bodies. Long term, full time employees, who enjoy top market wages and benefits, and part time, or newer full time employees who are paid a lower waged scale and usually get no benefits.
But, they're part time employees.

But, a lot of them aren't. A lot of the workers that management designated as part time are de facto full time employees while working the same amount of hours under a different designation at lower wages with no health or pension.
I'm with management.
Imagine my surprise.
A younger workforce puts a premium on job flexibility and they're unwilling to make a long time commitments to a single company. What do you expect?
Fair hiring practices.
Listen. McClane, Idaho? I need someone to monitor and keep the President and me updated throughout the day.
I'll do it.
You're going to work with Toby on the toast.
Don't need him.
Yes, you do.
It takes two people to write a toast?
The State Department's very particular about these toasts.
I'll assign someone from my office.
I can do it.
No. You can't.
Why not?
Because, you're a political consultant and... this is an actual... you know... thing.
Leo, please tell Josh that I can play a role in issues and it's not going to be the end to this administration?
I don't think it will be the end of this administration, Leo. I think it will be the end of this republic.
Establish a contact at the Justice Department and the FBI. And keep Josh informed throughout the day and night. What else?
[looks at a file] The... uh... Redskins suck.
Thank you. Meeting breaks up. Toby and Josh walk out to the HALLWAY. Donna was loitering around the meeting, smiling at Josh's comment. Toby comes up to her.
Donna?
Yeah?
Did Josh talk to you about the...?
Ramahedi Sumahedjo Bambang?
Yeah.
I'm on it.
Thank you.
Toby, did you know that in certain parts of Indonesia they summarily execute people who they suspect of being sorcerers?
Yes. He ducks into an office. Donna looks back at Josh.
[to Josh] You see?
You're all crazy.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. MURAL ROOM - DAY
Scenes.Description: Reporters and photographers are kept behind red velvet ropes on one side of the room as Bartlet and PRESIDENT SIGUTO of Indonesia stand between the American and the Indonesian flag. C.J. gets something from Bartlet and ducks out of the way.

Dialogues.Line: Mr. President?
No questions right now, Harry.
A short one.
She's not worried about the length of your question, she's worried about the length of my response. They all laugh. Flash bulbs pop. Bartlet talks to Siguto.
We're having salmon tonight.
Yes.
They told you that?
Yes. More pictures taken. Bartlet smiles and turns his head for the cameras. Siguto just sits and stares straight ahead.
Yo-yo Ma is going to play. [No answer.] Some Bach concertos, I believe. [Still no answer.] Do you like salmon?
No.
Well... our mistake.
Yes. Bartlet just smiles for the cameras.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. SAM'S OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Sam is sitting at his desk with the laptop when Toby comes in.

Dialogues.Line: What do you have so far?

Uh, we start by welcoming our friends and distinguished guests. We praise President Siguto for leading his country through a period that promises profound change as Indonesia moves from an authoritarian dictatorship towards a real democracy.
The beginnings of a real democracy.  Let's not get carried away.
All right. Ah... we have been friends for over 50 years...
Don't... Don't say friends.
It's a state dinner.
Fine. But I don't think we should remind people how friendly we were with dictators who oppressed their people while stealing their money.
How else are you going to steal people's money?
See, that's good. Write that in the toast? [starts to leave]
Toby?
Yeah?
You got something going on tonight with Josh?
We got to see a guy about a thing.
Need any help?
No. Toughen this up.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE ROOSEVELT ROOM - DAY
Scenes.Description: Management and Labor people are seated around the table, two of which are

Dialogues.Line: and SEYMOUR LITTLE. Leo barges in authoritarian and sits at the head of the table.
Thirty days with a federal mediator, you people couldn't work this out?
There's fundamental differences.
Name them.
It's the same differences.
Name them again.
The two-tiered hiring.
Leo, the trucking industry faces intense competition from Fed Ex and UPS, the railroads, the airlines, freight operations...
Seymour...
...For us to accept wage costs that are significantly greater than our competitors, would render us unable to compete...
You know, you're full of crap, Seymour.
This is the White House, Bobby, it's not the Jersey turnpike. Watch your mouth.
Forgive me.

For all the danger your industry's facing from competition, Seymour... the fact is, the trucks are still this country's number one way of moving things around. Including food. I'm talking about produce rotting in warehouses. I'm talking about fistfights in supermarkets over who gets the last bar of soap. [stands] You have until midnight.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Mandy is leaning against the door as Josh walks in.

Dialogues.Line: You don't think I can do this.
Why aren't you in your own office?
I don't have an office in this building.
There's a reason for that. They walk and talk into the HALLWAY.

The McClane police got a warrant to search this house. They had reason to believe there was a gun in that house that was made illegal by virtue of a barrel that was a quarter inch shorter than it was supposed to be. JOSH pours himself some coffee.
The people in this house, who are exactly who you think they are, refused entry to the police.
Did they... refuse it politely?
They produced weapons, if that's what you're asking.
Yes... that's what I'm asking you.
It really bugs you that the President listens to me sometimes.
Yes, but you shouldn't take it personally. It bugs me when the President listens to anyone who isn't me.
Do you know why the FBI had reason to believe there was an illegal weapon in this house? They enter JOSH'S OFFICE.
Why?
Because we sold it to them.
You know that for sure?

Yeah. Also, there are children in there. And a lot of crossed wires between the Deputy Attorney General and the FBI and Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms in terms of who's running the show. My point is, aside from everything else, this is a PR disaster waiting to happen. And it's going to happen today. This is why you hired me.
Yeah, I was wondering why that was.
[chuckles] It bugs you.
Yes. Mandy walks away. Josh whispers.
Yes.
* * * FADE IN:
DAY Bartlet and Siguto are sitting in chairs. Another group of reporters are standing across them. Cameras are again flashing.
President Siguto, how are you enjoying America so far?
Fine, thank you.
Would you mind expanding on that, sir? He doesn't respond. Bartlet leans over.
She'd like you to say a little more on the subject.
I have nothing more to say on the subject.
Okay.
One more question. Danny?
Mr. President?
Which one?
Pardon me. President Bartlet... I wondered if you noticed the protestors across the street this morning?
I try not to look out my window that much, Danny. What protestors?
Vermeil.
Vermeil?
Yes, sir.
Danny, I'm going to cover vermeil at the briefing, that's all folks, I got to bring in the next group.
Thank you. As reporters are filing out, Danny and C.J. talk into the HALLWAY.
You don't know what it's about, do you?
The protestors?
Yes.
It's about vermeil.
What's vermeil?
I happen to know what vermeil is.
[with a chuckle] Okay.
My one o'clock briefing is going to be about the vermeil protestors, isn't it?
Well, I just asked a question in front of 24 White House press reporters and you didn't answer it. So, I would assume that there would be some sort of follow-up, yes.
Thanks.
Anytime. Carol passes by.
Carol?
Yeah?
She's going to need you. [walks off]
What do you need?
I need to know what vermeil is and why people are protesting it.
Vermeil?
Yes.
...E-I-L? They walk inside THE OVAL OFFICE. Leo walks up to Bartlet and Siguto, who are still in their chairs.
Leo...
Good morning, sir. [to Siguto] Good morning, Mr. President. Would you excuse me, Mr. President? [back to Bartlet] Sir, if I could...
Absolutely.
Thank you.
[to Siguto] Would you pardon me one moment, please? [to reporters] Excuse me, folks. C.J. calls on Carol as Bartlet and Leo walk into LEO'S OFFICE. They whisper at the door.
I can't decide if that man is boring or rude, but he's one or the other.
I'm sorry to hear that.
I'm sitting out there trying to figure out how this guy campaign for something and win, then I remembered--we usually rig the elections.
There you go.
You think it's important he sit at my table tonight?
He's the guest of honor, so it is customary.
Where are you sitting?
At your table, sir.
Where's Toby sitting?
With C.J. and Josh and Sam.
Ah, that's the fun table.
Yeah.
What do you need?
I just wanted to let you know that we're going to clear out a battle carrier group from the Norfolk Naval Yard.
Because of the hurricane?
Yes. It's standard procedure. They want to get the ships out of the way.
All right, fine.

And this is just in case someone asks you why we deployed an entire group in the North Atlantic. Their conversation fades as they re-enter THE OVAL OFFICE. Bartlet sits in his chair. Cameras flashing, Siguto still sitting like a gargoyle.
Sorry to keep you waiting. [No answer.] Did I mention we're having salmon tonight?
Yes.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. TOBY'S OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: We look over Toby's shoulder as he writes in long hand on a legal pad. Sam is sitting on Toby's couch with his laptop on his lap.

Dialogues.Line: Read this. [hands Sam the pad, which Sam reads as Toby closes the door]
'Indonesia's constitution highlights democratic principles.' Toby...
Read.
I know what you're gearing up for.
Read!

[reads] 'The national ideology of Pancasila, upon which, your constitution is founded, includes a belief in the Supreme Being, while calling for religious tolerance.' I see you've underlined that. 'Freedom of the press, freedom of assembly...' Toby, do you think it a good idea to invite people to dinner and then tell them exactly what they're doing wrong with their lives?
Absolutely, otherwise it's just a waste of food.
Toby...
We're not telling them how to run their lives.
[reads again] 'It's time for your government to live up to the promises enshrined in the hearts and minds of your people as well as the laws of your land?'
Friendly reminder.
Can we soften the top of this?
No.

Something like... 'As has often been said, a true friend tells another friend the truth and on some issues, we must speak candidly, or we could not, in all honesty, hold the great honor of being known the world over as Indonesia's friend.'
Well... that was just about the worst writing I have ever heard.
I know.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. BRIEFING ROOM - DAY
Scenes.Description: C.J. is doing the briefing.

Dialogues.Line: Vermeil is gilded silver. Silver covered in gold. The White House has one of the largest collections in the world.
Why the protestors?
Well, these are 18th and 19th century French objects. Many designed by the noted European silversmith, Jean-Baptiste Claude Odiot. We see Danny's extremely smiling face.
The collection is kept in the Gold Room along with the ten-arm glass cut chandelier which was made in England in 1785.
C.J.? What does this have to do with the protestors?
Nothing at all. It's just interesting information and I thought I'd share it with you. Light chuckles from the audience.

Many workers were blinded by the mercury while making these pieces. Louis the 15th would melt them down to pay for his wars against his people. So, in general, they're seen in some circles as a symbol of a government's bloody and tyrannical oppression of its own people. We use them as centerpieces with a seasonal floral arrangement.
Is the President concerned this might send the wrong message?

[stares for a moment] I'll be honest with you, Tom. I haven't run this by the President yet, but I'll have that for you, plus the rest of the day's scores and highlights at the next briefing at 4:00 or 5:00. Thank you. As she leaves the podium, she meets Carol.
I won't need a transcript of that. C.J. walks out to the HALLWAY. where Danny catches up.
You're a rabble rouser, you know that? You rouse rabbles.
Hey...
I went and looked at your big vermeil demonstration. Six people in Lafayette Park with oak tag and magic markers.
I didn't say it was Selma, Alabama, or anything.
Six people! Six pathetic people protesting on a Friday and you just lent their weak and feeble voices a megaphone. What do you call that?
A job well done.
You're very proud of yourself.
Yeah. So, what are you wearing tonight?
What am I wearing tonight?
Yeah.
Your paper wants to know what I'm wearing?
Not my paper, that was just for me.
[stops] You want to know what I'm wearing?
Yeah.
[slowly] Well... I'm wearing... an evening gown of... gray silk.
Good, then. I'll be looking forward to it.
Well, okay. I got to go deal with the vermeil crazies.
See ya.
Okay. C.J. thinks it over after Danny walks away.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. DINER - DAY
Scenes.Description: Sam and Laurie are eating sandwiches. Laurie has a law book in his lap, sitting sideways in the booth.

Dialogues.Line: The point I was trying to make to Toby was that this toast is coming at the end of two days of policy talks. And maybe at dinner we could lighten it up.
Sam, I've got Com Law in an hour.
Should I sit quietly?
Yeah, 'cause I really need to study this.
No problem.
Thanks.
I'll eat my sandwich.
Good, Sam.
I'm having a hard time deciding between the ham and cheese and the chicken salad.
This might help you, the chicken salad's mine. [brings her plate closer to her]
Yeah, but this kind of environment is basically community food, right?
You're not afraid of being seen with me right now?
Because of the way you're dressed? She's dressed in college wear.
No, not... why? What's wrong with the way I'm dressed? No. Because of my night job, Sam. You're not afraid of being seen with me?
No.
Okay.
Your night job's crummy.
Yes. I know.
So, you got a thing tonight? A date?
A client?
Yeah.
Yeah.
Who?
Sam?
I was just...
I thought we had a deal.
Yes.
Thank you.
Where's he taking you?
I don't know.
Okay.
No. I really don't know, Sam. He calls me, he tells me what to wear and the rest of it is a big surprise.
Is this...?
Sam, I have class in an hour and I have not even finished...
Oh, for God's sakes, it's Gideon v. Wainwright, 372 US 335. You cite the precedent. You cite Black's opinion for the majority.
[stunned at his knowledge] Thank you for that display of geek bravado. But I'd like to learn this myself so I can graduate from law school, practice law, and give up my night job.
And I'd like you to learn my experience when I tell you that law school bears little relationship to the practice of law.
It bears some relationship to graduating, though, right?
Yes.
Then shut up.
I'm just saying. Your night job stinks.
Fine.
And I'm taking your sandwich.
Fine. She watches him take a bite of her sandwich as she bites down on a pickle.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE OVAL OFFICE - DAY
Scenes.Description: Two military types, Leo, Josh and Mandy, are meeting with the President.

Dialogues.Line: Certainly, I think we're all agreed that militias impose an inherent threat. They are very well armed condreys of dangerous lunatics bent on undermining the government.
Mr. President? Would it be inappropriate for me to join the discussion?
No, of course not.
Kooks, nuts, extremists, the lunatic fringe element. This is the inevitable and unavoidable by product of the democracy. Such as pornography is the unavoidable by product of free speech.
Excuse me, Mr. President. These people aren't thumbing through Hustler. They're armed. They're evading arrest and they're holding hostages.
We think they're holding hostages. Plus, we're the ones who sold them the gun in the first place.
Yes. It's called a sting, Mandy.
Yeah, but another word for it is entrapment.
Oh please. Pardon me, Mr. President, but the judge is never going to-
I'm not talking about the courts. I'm talking about public opinion.
Then this is two different conversations.
You want to raid this house?
We don't have to come in with guns blazing. We can simply fire tear gas through the windows.
And tomorrow's front page will be a screaming woman running out of a burning house with a baby in her arms and F.B.I. windbreakers in the foreground. Why can't we starve them out?
They've got like a five-year supply of food and water. To say nothing of ammunition.
Josh?
There's no way this'll end good. All that's left is to end it fast.
I agree.
What about a negotiator?
Negotiation what?
A peaceful settlement.
This is a stand off with federal officers. A peaceful settlement is 'put your guns down, you're under arrest.'
I think it would be wise if we demonstrated that we exhausted every possible peaceful solution before we got all Ramboed up.
All right, Mandy. Thank you. Josh? Would you two give us a minute, please? Josh and Mandy walk out into the OUTER OVAL OFFICE. They stay there as the door closes.
I don't think it's unreasonably macho for the White House to be aggressive in preserving democracy.

Let me tell you something. Ultimately, it is not the nuts that are the greatest threat to democracy, as history has shown us over and over and over again, the greatest threat to democracy is the unbridled power of the state over its citizens. Which, by the way, that power is always unleashed in the name of preservation.

This isn't abstract, Mandy. This isn't a theoretical problem. The FBI says come out with your hands up, you come out with your hands up. At which point, you're free to avail yourself of the entire justice system.
Do you really believe that? Or are you just pissed off because I got into the game? Leo opens the door and emerges from the Oval Office, walks straight to Mandy.
Mandy, the President's going to go with your plan. Chafey's going to send in a negotiator.
Good. Leo walks away.
Well, you're in the game now. Josh leaves. Mandy stays standing.

Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: INT. JOSH'S OFFICE - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Josh is wearing a tux. Donna is tying his white bow tie.

Dialogues.Line: If you can't explain what you're doing now, the assumption is that you're a sorcerer. If you try to run, the assumption is that you're a sorcerer. Okay? So, if anything happens, the prudent thing is to stand still and calmly explain your business.
Well, prudent or not, once the scythe comes out, I'm probably going to haul ass. Knock on the door. Charlie sticks his head in.
Excuse me.
What's up?
I hate to ask you this, but I need a favor.
What do you need?
My grandparents own a little house up the Georgia coast.
Are they evacuated?
I don't know where they are. I've been trying to get a hold of them all day.
They lost power lines in parts of Northeastern Georgia.
Um... I'm sorry to ask you this, but-
Don't worry about it. Donna, call FEMA, use my name. When that doesn't work, use Leo's name.
It's just that they don't get around too well.
We'll find them. Donna is on the phone already. Josh walks down the HALLWAY. Mandy is wearing a beige flowered sleeveless dress with a sienna colored wrap. She spied Josh and meets up with him.
Hi.
I look good tonight, don't you think?
Yes.
You look good too, but I look even better.
The FBI guy's been in there a couple of hours.
Yeah? They walk through the halls as workers are setting up floral arrangements and candles.
You think it's a good sign?
I really don't know.
I'm asking you what you think.
I don't have any thoughts on it one-way or the other.
So, what's happening with the teamsters?
I don't know.
Any news on the hurricane?
Not that I'm aware of.
What is it you do here exactly?
It's never really been made clear to me. Mandy chuckles. They reach the COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE. Sam comes out of his office, wearing a tux with tails and also a white bow tie.
Toby!
He's not here.
Hey.
We look good, don't we? Josh adjusts Sam's tie.
You guys want to be alone? [walks off]
Hey, I'm finishing up this speech... Do you think there's some sort of personal connection between President Siguto and the U.S.? You know, something from his past?
He was once almost pushed out of an airplane by a CIA trained operator.
I should probably leave that out.
Yeah. I would. Sam walks off. Josh comes out to the HALLWAY. Toby is down the hall, also wearing a tux with tails and a white bow tie.
Excuse me, Josh?
Hey.
Can I speak with you a moment?
Is he in?
Yes.
Let's go.
There's a problem.
What?
Mr. Minaldi! The door of one of the offices opens, MR. MINALDI walks out.
This is Mr. Minaldi. The interpreter from State.
You do speak Indonesian, don't you?
There's no such language as Indonesian. Indonesians speak 583 different languages. I speak Javanese. Mr. Bambang speaks Batak.
[calls] Donna!
[comes down the hall] I know, I know, I've got it under control.
It's 7:30, is there anyone left at state?
No.
Then, what are we doing?
Well, Mr. Minaldi speaks Portuguese.
Where does that get us?
Well, there's a guy who works in the kitchen who can translate Mr. Bambang's Batak into Portuguese. Then Mr. Minaldi will translate it into English.
Wait a minute... ah... Why can't the kitchen guy translate Batak into English?
The kitchen guy doesn't speak English.
You're kidding me.
Well, no. He speaks Batak and Portuguese so I wouldn't look down your nose.
Is the bar open yet?
Yeah.
Make this work. [walks off]
[arranges Josh's tie and whispers] I'm sorry.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. RECEPTION ROOM - NORTH LOBBY - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: C.J. is in her wonderful gown of gray silk--high neckline, sleeveless, with a gray silk wrap, dark gray gloves to the elbow and a sparkler of a diamond bracelet. She stops by a waitperson.

Dialogues.Line: Excuse me. Have you seen the First Lady?
[yelling from the distance] C.J.! C.J. walks to her and sure enough, ABIGAIL BARTLET is wearing exactly what C.J. told the press she'd be wearing.
Good evening, Mrs. Bartlet.
Nice threads girl. Showing a little dEcolletage wouldn't kill you dead.
Yes, ma'am. [giggles] Abbey takes her arm and steers her over to some people.
C.J., this is Harry and Nancy O'Malley. Douglas and Barbara Coleson. And their son, Steven, who's a cardiologist.
Nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you all.
This, of course is C.J., my husband's press secretary. She's not married, Steven, and she doesn't have a boyfriend.
Thank you, Mrs. Bartlet. C.J. smiles and takes Abbey away.
Abbey?
He's a doctor, C.J. He's heir to Coleson Technologies.
I appreciate the thought.
So, what's on your mind?
I spoke to Peggy about the vermeil. You might get a few questions.
I'm not embarrassed by the vermeil. It's not like we spent new money on it.
Yes, but it's history.
It's our history. Better or worse, it's our history. We're not going to lock it in the basement or brush it with a new coat of paint. It's our history.
Okay, well. Good answer.
You know, the truth will do it almost all the time.
Yes, ma'am.
C.J.? Cardiologist...
Yes, ma'am. [walks on] Abbey looks around the room and sees Leo.
Oh, I'm sorry. Is that Leo McGarry, or is that Fred Astaire? Leo smiles and they meet. Leo does a suave dance move.
Fred Astaire.
Leo, where's my husband?
He was caught on a call. He'll meet you over there.
What's happening with the teamsters?
They've been at it for ten hours.
What's your confidence?
We'll be okay.
Good. Mingle. Somewhere in the reception, Mandy nervously looks around. She goes out to the JOSH'S BULLPEN AREA. Donna is on the phone.
Anything yet?
I'm on with the Red Cross.
What about Idaho?
Nobody's calling back.
What is going on? [gets on another phone and dials]

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. RECEPTION ROOM - NORTH LOBBY - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Toby, Sam, and Josh are standing in a huddle. Leo comes up.

Dialogues.Line: Guys... shmooze someone for me. His name's Carl Everett, and he's raised a ton of money for us in the Midwest. Carl? I'd like you to meet...
Toby Ziegler... [shakes Toby's hand] Sam Seaborn... [shakes Sam's hand] and Joshua Lyman. [shakes Josh's hand]
Our reputations precede us.
They ought to. You three do fine work.
Excuse me, gentlemen. [leaves]
So, how long are you in town for, Mr. Everett?
Just for the night. Let me introduce my date. Brittany? The date turns around. It's Laurie, and Sam becomes uncomfortable.
This is Brittany. Brittany, this...
[hurriedly] Toby Ziegler. [shakes her hand]
Josh Lyman. [shakes her hand]
[puts out his hand for a shake] Sam Seaborn.
Nice to meet you.
We're going to head on over, but maybe I'll get a chance to talk to you all later.
Great.
Have a good time.
Thank you.
Okay.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. JOSH'S BULLPEN AREA - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Charlie walks by, and Donna calls out to him.

Dialogues.Line: Charlie! Charlie. Your grandparents are in a shelter in Granville.
Oh, man. Thank God. Thank you, Donna. You know how long they're going to have to stay there for?
Well, people are being sent back to their houses right now. Get this, the hurricane shifted direction.
You're kidding.
No. It's heading back out to the Atlantic. Leo walks by, into C.J.'S OFFICE. C.J. is holding satellite photos of the hurricane.
C.J.?
Leo.
What's happening?
It's a whole new situation.
It's moving east. It's moving back out. What kind of situation?
For some reason, there's a fleet of ships out there.
[stricken] Oh, God...
Do you know about this?
They evacuated a battle carrier group out of Norfolk this morning as a standard safety precaution.
They're sitting right in the path of the hurricane.
Can they get out?
Leo, the thing is 600 miles across. They're locked in. How bad can this get?
Catastrophic.
What do you want to do?
Let's do this thing, and then get ready.
I should start to work now.
Ah. I don't want to tip the press. Let's go to a party. [ushers C.J. out]
NIGHT Guests are being ushered at tables by men in dress uniforms. We are taken to the RECEPTION AREA. In a room attached to the formal dining room, Josh is on his cellphone.
Yeah, okay... I appreciate your call. Thank you. [hangs up]
[comes up] Josh. I'm not hearing anything from the FBI. And I'm not hearing anything from Justice. It's been about a half an hour and I can't get any information out of Idaho.
It's over.
What do you mean?
That was Chafey. They took the house. 34 occupants, they're all in custody.
What happened?
They shot the FBI negotiator. He's in critical condition. Clapping in the background.
Ladies and gentlemen... President and Mrs. Bartlet... accompanied by President and Mrs. Rahm Siguto. Josh is clapping with the crowd. Mandy is numb.
Mandy?
I... should call... get on the phone... I'm going to throw up. Mandy takes off. Josh claps for Bartlet, his wife, Abbey, and the guests.

Scenes.Scene Heading: FADE IN: INT. FORMAL DINING ROOM - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Bartlet and Leo are walking up the elegant stairs of the dining room, supposedly after the salmon.

Dialogues.Line: Without warning?
Yeah.
The hurricane just shifted direction without any warning?
It's not an anomaly, but it's unusual.
I would think. They walk inside the ELEGANT BRIEFING ROOM. Lots of computers, weather maps of the hurricane are inside. A captain is there.
Captain? How big is this carrier group? How many men and how many ships?

This battle group is made up of the aircraft carrier, John F. Kennedy, which carries a crew of 5,000 men. Two guided missile cruisers, two destroyers, and two battleships. All told, it's a little over 12,000 men.
How soon before the worst of it starts?
About 20 minutes.
Is there any way I can speak with the fleet commander?
It will take a few minutes. But we can set a hook up right here.
All right. Let's do it.
Thank you, Mr. President.
Thank you. Lightning flashes outside the window. The officer leaves.
Any word on the FBI guy's condition?
They're prepping him for surgery.
What do I do now?
Go back to the party. Bartlet and Leo move toward the door and two military guards open the door for them.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. THE WHITE HOUSE KITCHEN - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Amidst the very busy night in the kitchen, Toby is talking to GOMEZ, a member of the kitchen staff.

Dialogues.Line: Mr. Gomez... Camera zooms in. We see chaos as they're serving the state dinner. Toby is with Donna, Minaldi, Gomez, and the Indonesian diplomat, RAMAHEDI SUMAHEDJO BAMBANG.
Mr. Gomez, you speak Batak. Is that correct?
[translating] Senhor Gomez, o senhor fala Batak. Correto?
Sim.
[to Toby] Yes.
As you just did, you also speak Portuguese?
E como arabou de fazer, o senhor tambem fala Portugues?
Sim.
Yes.
But not English?
Mas nao fala Ingles?
Nao.
No.
Okay. Those are two pretty tough languages, Batak and Portuguese... you might want to take a crack at English one day, seeing as how you live here. Okay?
Okai. Sao linguas...
[stops him] No. Don't translate. [to Bambang] Mr. Bambang, thank you for agreeing to meet with me today.
Senhor Bambang, obregado por ter concorcado em vir me encortar.
Bapak Bambang, saya terima kasih bapak menyetujuin ketemu beseya saya.
Kembali.
[to Minaldi] Nao tem de que.
[to Toby] You're welcome.
Okay. It's going to be a long night for Toby by the looks of his expression. Josh comes in.
Sorry I'm late. I'm Josh Lyman.
Desculpem o atraso meu nome e Josh Lyman.
Ma'af saya telat nama saya Josh Lyman. Round of translations continue as Toby whispers to Josh.
This is going to take a while.
Pleased to meet you.
Are you enjoying the evening? Translations start.
Josh, this isn't the best context for chit-chat.
Mandy is pretty upset. I didn't do a great job.
I didn't like the salmon. Josh is confused.
He's answering a question from like a half hour ago. Mr. Bambang?
Why don't we just speak in English? Toby and Josh are stunned.
Donna...
I was told that he...
Yes.
You should keep in mind all the things I do right.
Yes.
Should I go?
Yes. Mr. Gomez, Mr. Minaldi, thank you for your trouble. Donna leaves, as well as Gomez and Minaldi.
What can I do for you, gentlemen?
[beat] A friend of mine is in one of your jails. I want you to let him out.
But your friend isn't an American.
He's French.
Then why not let the French take care of this one?
Because he's my friend and the French don't give a damn.
The extradition process is one that might...
We're not talking about the extradition process.
What we're talking about is that you unlock the cell, you put him in a car, and you drive him to the border.
Your friend led anti-government demonstrations?
That's what he does. He teaches students how to protest.
And so you're asking this as a favor?
Yes.
Senior aide to senior aide.
Yes.
I think you have a lot of nerve. That was a despicable and humiliating toast your President made. And I know you are the one who wrote it.

[stunned, rubs his eyebrow, as he's apt to do when flustered, tightly smiles] Please understand that with so many people watching... with so much media coverage... it was important for us to make clear that the United States, with it's commitment to human rights...
Mr. Ziegler. Does it strike you at all hypocritical that a people who systematically wiped out a century's worth of Native Americans should lecture the world so earnestly on human rights?
Yes, it does.
You humiliated my President tonight, qnd for no other reason than to show off. And now you want me to do you a favor? Go to hell. [leaves]
We'll talk to the French. [starts to leave, Toby is rooted to his spot] Toby. We'll talk to the French.
Yeah.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. C.J.'S OFFICE - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: We hear and see the storm outside as C.J. is typing on her computer. Danny stands by the door.

Dialogues.Line: That's a nice dress.
You're not supposed to be back here right now.
KDHN in Boise is reporting an FBI agent went down on a raid on a house in McClane.
We'll have a statement in 15 minutes.
What happened?
[gets up and walks to the door] Danny, did you hear me say we'll have a statement in 15 minutes? God, Danny.
What did I do?
When you flirt with me, are you doing it to get a story?
No.
Why are you doing it?
I'm doing it to flirt with you.
[goes back to her desk] I don't believe you.
I know.
So?
So, that's your problem.
Look...
When's Hurricane Sarah about to hit?
You know what? You're the one who goes around town saying that I'm too friendly with the press corps and that makes me a weak press secretary.
I never said you're a weak press secretary.
Yeah, but you've been thinking it.
I thought you did well with the vermeil scandal.
See? You're doing it.
I know.
I have work to do.
No problem. [about to walk off]
You really like the dress?
Yes.
All right. Whatever.
I hope the FBI guy pulls through.
15 minutes. Lightning flashes as she begins typing again. Danny smiles and walks down the hall.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. ROOSEVELT ROOM - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: The Teamsters and Labor are still at it.

Dialogues.Line: To accept these policies means that the Teamsters Union will be significantly weakened in its ability to represent or retain the loyalty of younger workers and we're not going to let that happen!
I disagree.
No kidding! Bartlet walks in and slams the door. All stand.
How are we doing?
We're at an impasse, Mr. President.
Hungry?
Yes, sir.
Tired?
Yes.
Talk to me for five minutes apiece and then we're going to settle this. They are about to sit.
Stay standing.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. FORMAL DINING ROOM - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Sam is at a table eating alone. Carl Everett and Laurie walk up.

Dialogues.Line: Sam.
Carl. Brittany.
Have you got just a minute?
Sure. [stands up and shakes his hand]
Can I cut to the last page?
Sure.
I think you're someone that I could have a relationship with.
You want to have a relationship with me?
What do you think?
I cost $500 an hour. Laurie reacts to that remark.
In the private sector. I billed out at $500 an hour.
I don't understand.
Would you like some of my food?
Oh, there's Todd. Excuse me. Todd? [walks off] Sam sits and Laurie hurriedly sits next to him.
I didn't know.
What were you thinking?
I didn't know where he was taking me. I told you I didn't know where he was taking me.
He just tells you what to wear.
That's right.
That's great.

You know, I'm sorry, Sam. But this isn't exactly your business. I'm not here because of you. I'm just here because I'm here. I would be here even if you were here or not. You're just some guy who happens to know me.
[angrily] Thank you.
I didn't... you know what I mean.
No. Could you keep talking about being here and not being here until blood starts pouring out of my ears?
[walks up] Sam. Sam and Laurie stand.
Mrs. Bartlet, good evening.
Are you enjoying yourself?
Yes.
Sam?
Yes?
Wouldn't you like to introduce me to your friend?
Okay.
Mrs. Bartlet, I'm Brittany Rollins.
Abigail Bartlet. [They shake hands.]
It's an honor to meet you, ma'am.
Oh, aren't you sweet? I'm sorry to interrupt you. Actually, I was looking for the President.
He had to step out to the West Wing.
Oh.
I'm not sure why, but I could...
To pistol-whip the trucking industry.
Why would he?
Because he can't save a gunshot victim and he can't stop a hurricane. [smiles at Laurie] You are thoroughly charming.
Thank you.
Excuse me.
Yes, ma'am. Abbey leaves. Sam sits back down.
That was incredible.
I'm just going to eat, if that's okay. Laurie still has her hand on her heart from meeting the first lady.
Sam...
I'll give you $10,000 not to go home with that guy tonight. Laurie keeps her hand to her heart, then walks away speechless.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. ROOSEVELT ROOM - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Everyone in the room is still standing.

Dialogues.Line: Such a broad inflationary surge would wreak havoc on the economic policies that have allowed the United States to enjoy an unprecedented...
Time's up.
Actually, if I may, Mr. President. I didn't get my full five minutes.

Yes, I know. But I got tired of listening to you. Now you listen to me. I have a Nobel Prize in Economics and I'm here to tell you that none of you know what the hell you're talking about. At 12:01 am, I'm using my executive power to nationalize the trucking industry.
You can't do that, Mr. President...
Fourteen White House lawyers disagree. Truman did it in '52 with the coalmine.
And it was struck down by the Supreme Court.

In 50 years, there's a new bench and I'll take my chances. As for Labor, I am calling Congress into Emergency Session to grant me the authority to draft the truckers into military service. You're going to love our food. Nice talking to you folks. If this isn't settled in 47 minutes, don't worry. We know where to find you. [walks out] Out in the HALLWAY, Bartlet walks by, looking at the floor.
I shouldn't have stayed away so long. Abbey is in the Oval Office doorway. Bartlet hadn't noticed her.
Hey... I'm all right. [holds her hands]
I shouldn't have extended the trip. I'm sorry.
I approved a plan for an FBI negotiator.
I know.
He's in surgery now.

I know. You know, one of the things that happens when I stay away too long, is that you forget that you don't have to power to fix everything. You have a big brain. And a good heart. And an ego the size of Montana. [They both snicker.] You do, Jed. You don't have the power to fix everything. But I do like watching you try. They hug tight. We hear the thunder outside. The dim, flicker, and then goes out for a moment.
What the hell? Well, if this isn't a metaphor for powerlessness, I don't know what is. We better get back to work, huh? They walk down the hall hand in hand.

Scenes.Scene Heading: CUT TO: INT. FORMAL DINING ROOM - NIGHT
Scenes.Description: Leo comes down the stairs as Bartlet and Abbey are going to go up.

Dialogues.Line: Mr. President...
We got the fleet commander?

Not yet. The JFK's radios have been knocked out along with communications on the Normandy and the South Carolina. All we've got is the Hickory. It's a little maintenance and supply boat that sails around with the fleet. They walk into the ELEGANT BRIEFING ROOM. Everyone's there already. Mandy, Toby, Josh, Sam, the captain and several guards. Bartlet walks to a table with Abbey and Leo.
So, I guess I'm going to talk to the Captain of the Hickory?
The intercom's been knocked out. They're looking for him on foot, sir.
Is there somebody on there now? [points to the radio]
The kid in the radio shack.
You're kidding.
No sir.
Jed, talk to the boy. The Captain pushes the speaker phone button.
Hello? [pause] Hello? Anyone there?
This is the U.S.S. Hickory.
Hickory, this is the White House. Who am I speaking to?
This is Signalman Third Class Harold Lewis.
Son? This is President Bartlet. [No answer.] Hello?
Yes, sir.
Is your C.O. around?
Sir, they're getting him right now, sir.
Can I talk to you in the meantime? [beat] Hello?
I'm... yes, sir.
Are you all right, Harold?
I hit my head on... I-I... I hit my head.
Are you bleeding?
Yes, sir.
Can you put something on it?
Well, I need to get to the other... I-I can't reach it and...
You go over and get it. I'll stay right here. A long pause.
Harold? [pause] Harold, are you back?
Yes, sir. I think the skipper should be here any minute, sir.
Can you tell us what's going on?
Well...
Harold?
Hello?
We're here.
Yeah.
Can you tell us what's going on?

Well, we're looking at I guess 80 foot seas with winds up to 120 knots. We're shipping solid green water over the bow. And we've got a fire in the engine room. We lost our running lights and may get run over by an aircraft carrier that can't see in the dark. Bartlet is at a loss of what to say and kneels down.
Well, I don't know, man. Sounds pretty bad, Harold. I think I'm going to ask for my money back. [pause] Harold?
Yes, sir.
I'm going to stay right here, as long as the radio works, okay? Abbey puts her hand on her husband's shoulder.
Yes, sir.
Hang on. The conversation continues.

Scenes.Scene Heading: DISSOLVE TO: END TITLES.
